channel.title: Script for Text-Based Game
channel.description:
Hi, I have been playing a web-based strategy game called OGame for a while. You can play it at www.ogame.org. The really annoying thing is that things take a long time to build. Do you think that I will be able to make a scar script that finds a text in the wepage then clicks on it, then finds another text to vertify that it worked, then it logs out, logs back in, and so on... Or basiclly: Does scar have a command for finding a text on a webage. For example could I give it a command to find the word "build" on a certain webpage? If the answer is yes then I think that everything else is straight foreward...
Thanks for you help, -Quilby

item.title: Script for Text-Based Game
item.dc:creator: @Quilby Quilby
item.description:
@Quilby wrote:

Ok thanks. Anyone else have any advice?[br][size=1]Posted at: May 27, 2006, 01:17:23 pm[/size][hr]I have created forums for chrisface doomsday and me to talk about ogame cheating. If anyone else wants to join and help us make ogame scipts than message me. I think that this will be a great challange for anyone and its pretty fun making ogame scripts. They are pretty easy.

If you wanna play ogame than join uni 10. Message me for anything about ogame.

Thats it for now…

Read full topic

item.title: Script for Text-Based Game
item.dc:creator: @Chrisface Chrisface
item.description:
@Chrisface wrote:

It searches an area of your choice. The first 4 variables are the co-ordinates 0,0 the top left and 800,600 the bottom right. You can change those to whatever area you’re searching for. The x,y variables return a co-ordinates which is the very top left of where the text was found. Say you were looking for “Here i am”, the co-ordinate would be right at the top left of the “H”. “TickerFont” is the font you declared before. The other variables you shouldn’t touch because they will just mess it up.

When you’re Declaring your text the variables are (Font name, font size, bold, italic, underline, strikethrough)

Read full topic

item.title: Script for Text-Based Game
item.dc:creator: @Quilby Quilby
item.description:
@Quilby wrote:

Does this search the whole screen or only a certain area? Could you explain the parameters a little more? Or could you upload you neopets script…

Thanks a lot!

Read full topic

item.title: Script for Text-Based Game
item.dc:creator: @Chrisface Chrisface
item.description:
@Chrisface wrote:

doomsday:

srl has find text, but the text must be in the same format as runescape is in.

Wrong.

What you have to do is something like the following.

  1. Force your web browser to display a nice and simple font (it’s in settings somewhere). I chose Courier New for this.
  2. Load the font size and so on… The method is in the scar help file.
    TickerFont := loadCharsFromFont2(‘Courier New’, 10, True, False, False, False);
  3. Use this to find your text
    if(IsTextInAreaEx(0, 0, 800, 600, x, y, ‘Looking for this text here’, 0, TickerFont, False, True, 0, 0, -1))then

I used this to create a neopets script that reads in and records stock information and the buys the best stock available. Good luck with it.

Read full topic
